item.content:encoded:
Meet OpenGameArt, a site where you can find many resources, related to games, public domain to use in your gamedev projects. Also, I’m uploading some interesting stuff there!

 

 

Hello folks, how are you doing?

 

During these years, I had several games development experiments, where I could program, work with 2d animations and level design for hobby..

 

 

A clear example is BrazSonic (BraSonic in portuguese), a freeware game which I released in 2004, where you play with a brazilian version of Sonic the Hedgehog, who needs to save the day from the corruption forces running through many sceneries based on some Brazil’s places. In addition to it, I ventured into other game projects, including the BrazSonic sequel, in my spare time, which I unfortunately could not take far ahead because of the lack of time invested in it.

 

I’m currently digging up some of the work I’ve done from scratch, which I think might be useful for game developers to use in their projects.

 

One of the online solutions for artists who choose to make part of their works reusable, is the OpenGameArt, a site that offers free materials that can be reused by other artists and game developers.

 

 

This website’s archive already has thousands of 2d and 3d art materials, pixel-art, sound effects, music tracks, all with different kinds of license levels of use such as Creative Commons and GPL. It reminds you a bit of sites like Pixabay, but more specific.

 

 

As I said before, the work I’m making available will be some 2d character animations, background and tile sets. Most inspired by the 2d games of the 16-bit era, like Sonic games themselves.

 

 

To access them, just go through: https://opengameart.org/users/bcsilva.

And I beg you to credit me by using some of my materials!
 
Good luck!
